main event: Multiple civilians observed a green fireball phenomenon in the sky near Flagstaff and Williams, Arizona, in April 1949.
interesting points: The sighting occurred around the same timeframe, with witnesses including a pastor and a bus driver., Observers reported the fireball was visible for about 1-2 seconds before disappearing., The fireball was described as bright green with a bluish tail and comparable to the size of a 100-watt light bulb at 25 feet., Witnesses were around 50-60 miles away from the fireball and noted no sound or smoke during the sighting., The fireball was seen traveling in a straight line, and its speed was estimated at about 262 miles per second if it were a meteorite.
witness description: Civilians including a pastor and a bus driver, all reported having a good character and being educated.
